answerText: sodium or Na+[10] NMDA channels allow sodium to leak into the membrane. Those channels are opened by this amino acid, which is the most common excitatory neurotransmitter in humans.

subject: Science
question: Question: One channel for this ion is blocked by tetrodotoxin and contains a series of 24 transmembrane helices arranged in four domains. For 10 points each: [10] Name this ion that migrates into neurons during an action potential. A lot of ATP is spent on the pump that exchanges it with potassium to maintain membrane potential.
